intro: Picea alcoquiana f. chlorocarpa, commonly known as the green cone fir, is a rare and unique variant of the alcoquiana fir. It is characterized by its distinctively green foliage, which sets it apart from the typical darker green needles of its parent species. The plant exhibits a conical shape with a dense crown, typical of many fir species. It thrives in cool, moist environments, often found in high-altitude regions. Due to its limited distribution and unique coloration, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists alike.
